definitions.definition: Action given to provide assistance; aid.
definitions.example: I need some help with my homework.

definitions.definition: (usually uncountable) Something or someone which provides assistance with a task.
definitions.example: He was a great help to me when I was moving house.

definitions.definition: Documentation provided with computer software, etc. and accessed using the computer.
definitions.example: I can't find anything in the help about rotating an image.

definitions.definition: (usually uncountable) One or more people employed to help in the maintenance of a house or the operation of a farm or enterprise.
definitions.example: Most of the hired help is seasonal, for the harvest.

definitions.definition: Correction of deficits, as by psychological counseling or medication or social support or remedial training.
definitions.example: He really needs help in handling customer complaints.

definitions.definition: To provide assistance to (someone or something).
definitions.example: He helped his grandfather cook breakfast.

definitions.definition: To assist (a person) in getting something, especially food or drink at table; used with to.
definitions.example: Help yourself to whatever's in the fridge.

definitions.definition: To contribute in some way to.
definitions.example: If you want to get a job, it helps to have some prior experience.

definitions.definition: To avoid; to prevent; to refrain from; to restrain (oneself). Usually used in nonassertive contexts with can.
definitions.example: Are they going to beat us? Not if I can help it!

definitions.definition: A cry of distress or an urgent request for assistance
definitions.example:
— Take that, you scoundrel.
— Help! Robin, help!
